rev.comment: /* Occupy Cal */ restore section removed by anon-- OccupyUCDavis is in response to PoliceViolence at OccupyCal, so this is a critical bridge in the timeline of the Davis article. will clarify
rev.diff:
Line 12: Line 12:
{{main|Occupy Cal}}
{{main|Occupy Cal}}
[[Occupy Cal]] is an on-going series of protests at [[UC Berkeley]]. A major theme of the Occupy demonstrations at California public universities is the role of [[education]] in creating [[jobs]] and improving the quality of life of society as a whole, and the contrasting failure of the [[UC Regents]] and the [[California|State of California]] to honor commitments made in the California Master Plan for Higher Education. Recent 81% tuition increases for students, mandatory furloughs (including for professors), firings of lower-ranking workers (especially those working directly with students), and well-publicized raises for the highest paid administrators link here have further fueled discontent both within the [[University of California]] system (of which [[UC Davis]] is a part) and within the [[California State University]] system, which has also seen large tuition raises and consequent protests.
[[Occupy Cal]] is an on-going series of protests at [[UC Berkeley]]. A major theme of the Occupy demonstrations at California public universities is the role of [[education]] in creating [[jobs]] and improving the quality of life of society as a whole, and the contrasting failure of the [[UC Regents]] and the [[California|State of California]] to honor commitments made in the California Master Plan for Higher Education. Recent 81% tuition increases for students, mandatory furloughs (including for professors), firings of lower-ranking workers (especially those working directly with students), and well-publicized raises for the highest paid administrators link here have further fueled discontent both within the [[University of California]] system (of which [[UC Davis]] is a part) and within the [[California State University]] system, which has also seen large tuition raises and consequent protests.
  +   +
==Police violence at Occupy Cal and backlash==
  +
{{ external media
  +
| align = right
  +
| width =
  +
| video1= [http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=buovLQ9qyWQ Police beat and arrest students at UC Berkeley], Nov 9
  +
}}On November 9, students and professors at UC Berkeley began with a series of "teach-ins" around campus, a noon rally and march. Approximately 1,500 demonstrators attended the days' events. <ref name=10KGO>{{cite news|last=Hollyfield|first=Amy|title=Occupy Cal calm, but ready for showdown|url=http://abclocal.go.com/kgo/story?section=news/local/east_bay&id=8426365|accessdate=13 November 2011|newspaper=KGO-TV|date=10 November 2011}}</ref> Midday, protestors set up seven tents to symbolize their support for [[Occupy Movement]]. In response, law enforcement officials from UC Berkeley Police, the [[Alameda County Sheriff's Office]] and other UC Police officers in [[riot gear]] arrived to remove the seven tents from the protest site. <ref>{{cite news|last=Asimov|first=Nanette|title=Occupy Cal protesters vote to strike on Tuesday|url=http://www.sfgate.com/cgi-bin/article.cgi?f=/c/a/2011/11/10/MNH21LT6ND.DTL|accessdate=13 November 2011|newspaper=San Francisco Chronicle|date=11 November 2011}}</ref> <ref name=SF2>{{cite news|last=Asimov|first=Nanette|title=UC campus police move in on student protesters|url=http://www.sfgate.com/cgi-bin/article.cgi?f=/c/a/2011/11/10/BA861LSR8G.DTL|accessdate=13 November 2011|newspaper=San Francisco Chronicle|date=10 November 2011}}</ref>
  +   +
Video footage of the afternoon confrontation showed police beating protesters with batons and dragging two protesters by the hair, one of whom was UC Berkeley English professor [[Celeste Langan]]. <ref>{{cite news|last=Gollan|first=Jennifer|title=UC Berkeley Pledges to Investigate Police Response to Occupy Cal Protest|url=http://www.baycitizen.org/occupy-movement/story/uc-berkeley-pledges-investigate-police/|accessdate=13 November 2011|newspaper=The Bay Citizen|date=11 November 2011}}</ref> 39 protesters including Professor Langan were arrested for charges including "resisting and delaying a police officer in the performance of their duties, and failure to disperse when given a dispersal order."<ref>{{cite news|last=Bowe|first=Rebecca|title=Occupy Cal makes its dramatic entrance|url=http://www.sfbg.com/politics/2011/11/10/occupy-cal-makes-its-dramatic-entrance|accessdate=13 November 2011|newspaper=San Francisco Bay Guardian|date=10 November 2011}}</ref>
  +   +
===Response to Occupy Cal beatings===
  +
The ACLU expressed "grave concerns" about the use of batons on protesters. The UC Student Association a statement saying
  +
"UC Students are outraged by the brutal tactics used by the UCPD against students." <ref>{{cite news|last=Applegate|first=Jamie|title=Reactions to the police response to Occupy Cal on Nov. 9|url=http://www.dailycal.org/2011/11/13/reactions-to-the-police-response-to-occupy-cal-on-nov-9/|accessdate=13 November 2011|newspaper=The Daily Californian|date=13 November 2011}}</ref>
  +   +
In response to the police brutality and other perceived failings of [[Robert Birgeneau|Birgeneau]] and the [[UC Regents]], the [[Occupy Cal]] General Assembly called for a general UC strike on November 15th, 2011. Other student groups from around the state announced plans to join in the protest. On November 11, the [[UC Davis]] Faculty Association also voted to endorse the November 15 systemwide strike. <ref>[http://ucdfa.org/2011/11/11/dfa-endorses-occupy-cals-call-for-strike/ Davis Faculty Association Endorses Occupy Calâs Call for Strike]</ref>
==Police violence at Occupy UC Davis==
==Police violence at Occupy UC Davis==
